sentences.english: The Maybach has been adopted as the ultimate status symbol by Russia's super-rich.
sentences.chinese: 迈巴赫被视作俄国超级富豪的”终极身份象征“。

sentences.english: After the US, no other country has so many people in this list.
sentences.chinese: 除了美国以外，没有其它国家有如此多的富豪入围。

sentences.english: As a result, the number of Spanish HNWIs increased by 18%.
sentences.chinese: 结果是，西班牙的大富豪人数增加了18%。

sentences.english: But central and western areas of China have the speediest growth rates.
sentences.chinese: 然而，中国中部和西部富豪的增长速度最快。

sentences.english: Knowledge economy is sure to make new billionnaires.
sentences.chinese: 知识经济必然创造了一些新富豪。

sentences.english: From Kepi's standpoint they are all nabobs.
sentences.chinese: 根据凯皮的观点，这些同胞全是大富豪。

sentences.english: But how easy will it be to get hold of their money?
sentences.chinese: 但是要将富豪的钱财乾坤大挪移过来，谈何容易？

sentences.english: In the last year he has successfully joined this 10 rich.
sentences.chinese: 而在去年他曾成功晋身10大富豪。

sentences.english: The company set up the first online dating web site designed specifically for multimillionaires.
sentences.chinese: 该公司建立了首个专为富豪设计的在线约会网站。

sentences.english: Nearly half Chinese multi-millionaires consider immigration, what are they afraid of?
sentences.chinese: 中国近半数千万富豪考虑移民他们在怕些什么？

sentences.english: She seems caught in a loveless marriage with a rather cold and distant plutocratic husband.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎陷入了爱情与婚姻，而寒冷和遥远的富豪丈夫。

sentences.english: He then urged Americans to raise taxes on the rich like himself.
sentences.chinese: 他还促使美国政府提高对像他这样的富豪的征税。

sentences.english: Indonesia's rupiah trillionaires have so much money that it's difficult to count it.
sentences.chinese: 印度尼西亚的亿万富豪钱多得都没法准确计算了。

sentences.english: The average age of a multimillionaire is 39.
sentences.chinese: 千万富豪平均年龄为39岁。

sentences.english: Du was China's 2nd-wealthiest man in 2008, according to the Hurun rich list.
sentences.chinese: 杜双华曾名列2008年度胡润中国富豪榜第2。

sentences.english: The plutocrats may yet be tightening their purse strings.
sentences.chinese: 而富豪们可能仍旧会捂紧自己的钱包。

definition: children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
Monopoly (game)/known as 大富翁[Da4 fu4 weng1] in PRC
